page.title: 02CHRIST CHURCH FAIRWARP
page.content: The church at Fairwarp on Ashdown Forest was built in 1881 as a chapel. It was built of sandstone and the tower and sanctuary were added by Sir Bernard Eckstein in memory of his father in 1935. He also added the eight bells in 1947 and the clock in memory of his mother and sister. The font where babies are christened is 100 years old and the bible is fourteen years old. The lectern is a revolving one. There are over 132 hassocks embroidered by the people who go to the church. In June 1985 the church had a Flower Festival for the Golden Jubilee. I visited the church with my mummy and sister. There was an art exhibition, bell ringing, a concert and services. In the churchyard there are Scots pine growing and a kissing gate.
